stories.title: We save our time with DevOps

stories.text:
Many people had the hope that politician's presence on Twitter would enable more direct contact with the citizens. However, all political sides mainly use Twitter to dumb down discourse, virtue signal and blast out propaganda.

I think it is time to return to the pre-Twitter days.
stories.title: Ask HN: Should all politicians be banned from Twitter?
Netflix to be forced to broadcast Putin propaganda
Manage Podcasts on an iPod Classic on Linux
Ukrainians turned to encrypted messaging app Signal as Russians invaded

stories.text: My company has grown a lot in the last few years and the IT org has added a lot of processes and procedures. Some kind of make sense to me, others don't. My manager is new to the company and is one of the people pushing for all the new processes. I've advocated against a few  policies with some success, but I feel like I'm just delaying them by six months. Does anyone have any stories, tips, books, or advice on how to handle situations like this? I can't decide if I should be even louder advocating against all the changes or just go around the policies and do whatever I think is best or just give up and go along with it.
stories.title: Ask HN: Tips for Dealing with Corporate Processes?
Along Mexicoâ€™s Riviera Maya, Tourists, Drugs and Violence
